caption:
The photograph shows a group of elderly people engaged in a quilting activity. There are five women visible, attentively working on a large, colorful quilt spread across a long table in a room that suggests a homely ambiance.

The table, covered with patches of differently patterned fabrics, forms a vivid mosaic of blues, reds, yellows, and other colors. Various pieces of fabrics and sewing materials, including a blue yarn ball and a pincushion, are scattered atop the quilt, emphasizing the activity at hand.

Each person has a specific task, with some sewing and others arranging or inspecting the fabric pieces. The focus and dedication to their crafting is evident in their expressions and postures.

The room has a warm, inviting feel, thanks to wood-paneled walls and a sideboard, a framed artwork hanging on the wall, and natural light seemingly coming through a window, which casts a soft glow on the entire scene.

This quaint setting not only captures a moment of communal craftsmanship but also serves as a snapshot of social and creative engagement among the elderly.
title: Senior citizens in New Ulm, Minnesota, making a quilt. They are attempting to keep the old frontier crafts alive. New Ulm is a county seat trading center of 13,000 in a farming area of south central Minnesota. It was founded in 1854 by a German immigrant land company that encouraged its kinsmen to emigrate from Europe. The town had a stable population of 8 to 9,000 during the first half of the century, then began to grow with the arrival of manufacturing firms.
